marytts.util.string

Class ByteStringTranslator

  • java.lang.Object
    • marytts.util.string.ByteStringTranslator

  • public class ByteStringTranslator
extends Object
    A helper class converting between a given set of bytes and strings.
    Author:
    schroed

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAXNUM
      The maximum number of values that this translator can handle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteStringTranslator()
      Initialize empty byte-string two-way translator.
      ByteStringTranslator(int initialRange)
      Prepare a ByteStringTranslator to hold the given amount of data.
      ByteStringTranslator(String[] strings)
      Initialize a byte-string two-way translator, setting byte values according to the position of strings in the array.

    • Field Detail

      • MAXNUM

        public static final int MAXNUM
        The maximum number of values that this translator can handle. This is the highest possible number that we can still represent as an unsigned byte.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • ByteStringTranslator

        public ByteStringTranslator()
        Initialize empty byte-string two-way translator.

      • ByteStringTranslator

        public ByteStringTranslator(int initialRange)
        Prepare a ByteStringTranslator to hold the given amount of data. After calling this the getNumberOfValues() will still return 0, since there is no actual data yet.
        Parameters:
        initialRange - the number of values to expect
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if initialRange is larger than the maximum number of values, MAXNUM.

      • ByteStringTranslator

        public ByteStringTranslator(String[] strings)
        Initialize a byte-string two-way translator, setting byte values according to the position of strings in the array.
        Parameters:
        strings - a list of up to MAXNUM strings to be represented by unique byte values.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if list of strings is longer than the maximum number of values, MAXNUM.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(byte b,
       String s)
        Associate the given (unsigned) byte with the given String. Values greater than 127 can be used simply by casting an int to a byte: set((byte)129, "mystring")
        Parameters:
        b - b
        s - s

      • contains

        public boolean contains(String s)
        Verify if the given string can be translated into a byte by this translator.
        Parameters:
        s - s
        Returns:
        map.containsKey(s)

      • contains

        public boolean contains(byte b)
        Check if the given (unsigned) byte value is contained in the list. This supports values between 0 and MAXNUM, cast to byte: contains((byte)129) will indicate if there is a String for the 129'th byte value.
        Parameters:
        b - b
        Returns:
        false if index < 0 or index ≥ size of list, true otherwise

      • get

        public byte get(String s)
        Get the (unsigned) byte value associated to the given string.
        Parameters:
        s - s
        Returns:
        the (unsigned) byte value associated to the given string. To cast this into an integer, use value & 0xFF.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string is unknown to the translator.

      • get

        public String get(byte b)
        Look up the (unsigned) byte in this translator. This supports values between 0 and MAXNUM, cast to byte: get((byte)129) will get you the 129'th item in the string list.
        Parameters:
        b - b
        Returns:
        list.get(index)

      • getStringValues

        public String[] getStringValues()

      • getNumberOfValues

        public int getNumberOfValues()
        Give the number of different values in this translator.
        Returns:
        size of list
